channel.title: Daily News Feed Update #1
channel.description: Daily collected titles from multiple sources

item.title: English Editorials (Update #1) • What native-held lands in California can teach about resilience and the future of wildfire

Magazines (Update #1) • OpenAI’s New Sora App Lets Users Generate AI Videos—And Star in Them • Part of a Pig Liver was Transplanted into a Human • The Science Behind Peak Fall Colors: What to Expect in 2025 • Alzheimer’s-Related Biomarker Found at Elevated Levels in Newborns • The San Andreas and Cascadia Earthquake Faults May Be Linked • Can You See the Earth and Moon from Mars? • Inside the Medical Challenges of Presidential Health Care • Physicists are uncovering when nature’s strongest force falters • Serum based on plant extracts boosts hair growth in weeks • Evolution of intelligence in our ancestors may have come at a cost

International (Update #1) • Baby giant tortoises thrive in Seychelles after first successful artificial incubation • DRC says EU’s minerals deal with Rwanda is ‘obvious double standard’ • Venezuelan politician María Corina Machado wins Nobel peace prize • Peru lawmakers vote to oust president Dina Boluarte over crime crisis • Trump threatens 100% China tariffs as Beijing restricts rare-earth exports • Seven people killed after twin earthquakes off coast of Philippines • US farmers caught in Trump-China trade war – who’ll buy the soybeans? • Weather tracker: South-east China swelters in summer-like heat • Tsunami threat lifted after Philippine earthquake – as it happened • Three people dead after light plane crashes on take-off near Wollongong • Baby numbats spotted at two wildlife sanctuaries in hopeful sign for one of Australia’s rarest marsupials • Crocodile made famous by Steve Irwin ‘wrongfully arrested’ and should be returned to wild, traditional owners say • Rebel Wilson using US court proceedings to ‘harass and intimidate’ star of The Deb, court told • Independent Sophie Scamps quits parliamentary sports club after Pocock ban – as it happened • Macron reappoints Sébastien Lecornu as French prime minister • Nobel peace prize officials investigate surge in bets for winner • Britons travelling to EU to undergo new biometric checks at border from Sunday • Macron summons parties for crunch meeting in frantic effort to appoint PM • The £1m man: why did Boris Johnson take his donor to Ukraine? • Hamas praises Trump but says Tony Blair not welcome in post-war Gaza role – as it happened • Palestinians displaced to southern Gaza begin journey home as ceasefire comes into effect • Hamas will be disarmed, Netanyahu vows after ceasefire begins • Man jailed for at least 23 years for murdering Syrian boy in Huddersfield • Man in serious condition after being shot by police in London • Boris Johnson breached rules designed to stop abuse of contacts made in public office, watchdog finds • Labour’s softening stance towards China reinforced by dropped spy case • Richard Tice accepted stay at French Riviera home of Tory donor • Zarah Sultana compares Jeremy Corbyn reunion to Gallagher brothers • After uproar, Pete Hegseth clarifies Qatari air force facility in Idaho is not a foreign base – as it happened • Trump completes ‘semiannual’ physical before traveling to Middle East • White House announces federal worker layoffs as shutdown nears third week • AstraZeneca makes deal with Trump to lower drug prices and avoid tariffs • Chicago TV journalist pushed to ground and arrested during Ice raid, later released
Geopolitics (Update #1) • ‘Constitutional Patriotism’ • A Rare Sign of Life in Congress
